symptoms.name: Shortness of breath
symptoms.pattern: Developed 3 days prior to admission, rapidly worsening

symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.pattern: Developed 3 days prior to admission, productive of pink-tinged sputum

symptoms.name: Weakness
symptoms.pattern: Present for 3 days prior to admission

symptoms.name: Chest heaviness
symptoms.pattern: Present for 3 days prior to admission

symptoms.name: Chills
symptoms.pattern: Present for 3 days prior to admission

symptoms.name: Sore throat
symptoms.pattern: Present for 1 week prior to admission (in one case)

risk_factors: Occupation involving handling of animal products (e.g., tannery worker)

chest_x-ray: Marked widening of the superior mediastinum
CT_chest: Edema and hemorrhage in soft tissues surrounding trachea, bronchi, and hilar regions
Complete infiltration of mediastinal fat planes
Encasement and compression of hilar vessels
Intact 4.2-cm aneurysm of the ascending aorta (incidental finding)

required: Positive Bacillus anthracis culture or PCR from blood, bronchial washings, or pleural fluid
Characteristic clinical presentation (e.g., respiratory distress, mediastinal widening)
supportive: Imaging findings consistent with pulmonary anthrax

differential_diagnoses: Dissecting ascending aortic aneurysm with leakage
